meanings.definition: To remove errors or defects from (a computer program)
meanings.sent1: She debugged the program by fixing all the mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The software developer debugged the code before releasing it.
meanings.sent3: The programmer debugged the code with a magnifying glass, looking for tiny errors.
meanings.sent4: He debugged the program like a detective solving a mystery.
meanings.sent5: After she debugged the code, it ran smoothly without any issues.

meanings.definition: To identify and eliminate faults in (a system or plan)
meanings.sent1: They debugged the plan by finding and fixing all the problems.
meanings.sent2: The team debugged the system to ensure it worked flawlessly.
meanings.sent3: He debugged the system by pretending to be a superhero fixing a broken machine.
meanings.sent4: She debugged the plan like a chef perfecting a recipe.
meanings.sent5: After they debugged the system, it operated efficiently without any glitches.
